meanings.definition: Able to be justified or forgiven.
meanings.sent1: It was excusable for him to be late because of the traffic.
meanings.sent2: Her mistake was excusable since it was her first day on the job.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's excusable mischief made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The excusable delay in the project allowed for more thorough planning.
meanings.sent5: The excusable error in the recipe led to a delicious new dish.

meanings.sent1: His excusable behavior was due to the stressful situation.
meanings.sent2: The child's excusable tantrum was quickly forgotten.
meanings.sent3: The excusable mix-up at the party caused some confusion but was easily resolved.
meanings.sent4: Her excusable forgetfulness about the meeting time was a rare occurrence.
meanings.sent5: The excusable oversight in the report was quickly rectified.
